review: This was an upgrade from Chromecast for us, and wow the choices! We can run Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, and so much more from a small remote that comes with. We are thinking seriously of downgrading our cable service as a result to save some money whilst adding to our selection of shows (currently subscribed to Netflix Hulu and one other)  all for about 1/3 the price ($30 vs $90-plus)! Although we will occasionally get a small hiccup, where the streaming needs to "catch up"  for a second or two (and I think this has to do more with ones internet connection and/or the number of customers online (during a holiday weekend lets say) it has really not been a problem at all. Plus when the weather knocks out dish out ( which is a lot around here) we still have TV to watch!  This is definitely a keeper!
author: M. C. Fees "Maycee"

Interface and remote are good.You have to push a button on the remote to wake it up when you shift sources (TV to HDMI where it is plugged in) otherwise you just get a black screen on your tv.I didn't do my research well enough and didn't realize you need the box type Fire TV to play most of the better games so make sure this unit is what you want.My units software doesn't recognize that it is plugged into the wall so says it reduces it's functionality as if it was plugged into the USB port for power but I haven't noticed anything so no big deal.
